019package org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc;
020
021import static java.lang.System.arraycopy;
022import static java.lang.System.getProperty;
023import static java.lang.System.out;
024import static java.util.stream.Collectors.joining;
025import static java.util.stream.Collectors.toList;
026import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.INTERNAL;
027import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
028import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.IncludeTaglet.ProcessMode.DEFAULT;
029import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.Common.SOURCE_PATH;
030import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.Common.createLineNumberFormatString;
031import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.Common.determineElementName;
032import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.Common.initHelperTaglets;
033import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants.EMPTY_STRING;
034import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants.EMPTY_String_ARRAY;
035import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;
036import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.IOUtils.loadToString;
037import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.format;
038import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.isNotEmptyOrBlank;
039import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.splitString;
040
041import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
042import javax.tools.FileObject;
043import java.io.BufferedReader;
044import java.io.File;
045import java.io.FileReader;
046import java.io.IOException;
047import java.io.Reader;
048import java.util.ArrayList;
049import java.util.EnumSet;
050import java.util.List;
051import java.util.Optional;
052import java.util.Set;
053
054import org.apiguardian.api.API;
055import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
056import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.Common;
057import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.JavadocError;
058import org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils;
059import org.tquadrat.foundation.util.Template;
060import com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree;
061import jdk.javadoc.doclet.Doclet;
062import jdk.javadoc.doclet.DocletEnvironment;
063import jdk.javadoc.doclet.Taglet;
064
065/**
066 *  <p>{@summary This taglet allows to include the contents of an external file
067 *  into the JavaDoc documentation.} This is particularly useful when the
068 *  contents of resource files (like a DTD or an XML Schema) should be shown in
069 *  the documentation.</p>
070 *  <p>Usually, that file is stored somewhere on the
071 *  {@link Common#SOURCE_PATH SOURCE_PATH}; this means that a file is addressed
072 *  by its path name on the source tree. For example to include this file, the
073 *  path would be
074 *  {@code org/tquadrat/foundation/javadoc/IncludeTaglet.java}.</p>
075 *  <p>But additional roots can be provided through system properties, where
076 *  the name of the new root will be prefixed by
077 *  {@value #PROPERTY_INCLUDE_ROOT_PREFIX}, like
078 *  {@code org.tquadrat.foundation.include.root.resources}. To use this root,
079 *  prefix the path in the tag with {@code ${resources}}.</p>
080 *  <p>The file contents can be processed in some way before it will be
081 *  included; refer to
082 *  {@link ProcessMode}
083 *  for the details.</p>
084 *  <p>The use of this tag will look like this:</p>
085 *  <pre><code>&hellip; {&#64;include &lt;<i>filename</i>&gt;:&lt;<i>processMode</i>&gt;} &hellip;</code></pre>
086 *  {@ignore {@include <filename>:<processMode>}}
087 *  <p>where the &lt;processMode&gt; can be omitted. If the given file does not
088 *  exist or is empty, nothing will be included, and no error message will be
089 *  issued.</p>
090 *
091 *  @note   If Maven is used, and the include file is not placed at the
092 *      {@code java} path (but on the {@code resources} path, for example}, it
093 *      is required to add the parameter <code>&lt;sourcepath&gt;</code> to the
094 *      configuration of the {@code maven-javadoc-plugin}, where the path of
095 *      the include file is added; otherwise, it will not be found.
096 *      Alternatively an external root can be used, as described above.
097 *
098 *  @note   At default, Gradle adds only {@code *.java} files as sources for
099 *      the Javadoc task. To make other files available for the
100 *      {@code @include} tag, an external root should be used. This is
101 *      mandatory for files that are stored at the {@code resources} path.
102 *
103 *  @note   In general, both Maven and Gradle may have funny ideas about the
104 *      source path, so the recommendation is to use an external root always.
105 *
106 *  @note   If the source of a class should be included, the path to the source
107 *      file is relative to the module directory, if one exists.
108 *
109 *  @note   The {@code {@include}} tag is an inline tag; that means that the
110 *      contents of the included file will be seamlessly integrated into the
111 *      other text of the respective Javadoc comment.
112 *
113 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
114 *  @version $Id: IncludeTaglet.java 826 2021-01-04 12:17:23Z tquadrat $
115 *  @since 0.0.5
116 *
117 *  @UMLGraph.link
118 */
119@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: IncludeTaglet.java 826 2021-01-04 12:17:23Z tquadrat $" )
120@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
121public class IncludeTaglet implements Taglet
122{
123        /*---------------*\
124    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
125        \*---------------*/
126    /**
127     *  The process modes for the included file.
128     *
129     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
130     *  @version $Id: IncludeTaglet.java 826 2021-01-04 12:17:23Z tquadrat $
131     *  @since 0.0.5
132     *
133     *  @UMLGraph.link
134     */
135    @SuppressWarnings( "InnerClassTooDeeplyNested" )
136    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: IncludeTaglet.java 826 2021-01-04 12:17:23Z tquadrat $" )
137    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5", consumers = "org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc" )
138    public enum ProcessMode
139    {
140            /*------------------*\
141        ====** Enum Declaration **=============================================
142            \*------------------*/
143        /**
144         *  The default mode that is used if no process mode is given; the same
145         *  as
146         *  {@link #ESCAPE}.
147         */
148        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
149        DEFAULT
150        {
151            /**
152             *  {@inheritDoc}
153             */
154            @Override
155            public final String processFile( final String fileName, final Reader reader, final String... params )
156            {
157                return ESCAPE.processFile( fileName, reader, params );
158            }   //  processFile()
159        },
160
161        /**
162         *  HTML relevant characters will be escaped in the file contents, and
163         *  line breaks are replaced by the HTML tag {@code <br>}.
164         */
165        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
166        ESCAPE
167        {
168            /**
169             *  {@inheritDoc}
170             */
171            @Override
172            public final String processFile( final String fileName, final Reader reader, final String... params )
173            {
174                final String retValue;
175                try( final var bufferedReader = new BufferedReader( reader ) )
176                {
177                    retValue = bufferedReader.lines()
178                        .map( StringUtils::escapeHTML )
179                        .collect( joining( "<br>" ) );
180                }
181                catch( final IOException e )
182                {
183                    throw new JavadocError( format( MSG_ProcessingProblem, fileName ), e );
184                }
185
186                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
187                return retValue;
188            }   //  processFile()
189        },
190
191        /**
192         *  The file contents will be included as is; this works for really
193         *  simple plain text files that do not contain any HTML relevant
194         *  characters, or for valid HTML snippets.
195         *
196         *  @note   Line breaks are ignored by HTML browsers; this means that a
197         *      plain text file will appear as a long single line.
198         */
199        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
200        PLAIN
201        {
202            /**
203             *  {@inheritDoc}
204             */
205            @Override
206            public final String processFile( final String fileName, final Reader reader, final String... params )
207            {
208                final String retValue;
209                try
210                {
211                    retValue = loadToString( reader );
212                }
213                catch( final IOException e )
214                {
215                    throw new JavadocError( format( MSG_ProcessingProblem, fileName ), e );
216                }
217
218                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
219                return retValue;
220            }   //  processFile()
221        },
222
223        /**
224         *  The file contents is source code of some kind. It will be treated
225         *  as for
226         *  {@link #ESCAPE},
227         *  and additionally, each line will be prefixed with a line number.
228         */
229        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
230        SOURCE
231        {
232            /**
233             *  {@inheritDoc}
234             */
235            @Override
236            public final String processFile( final String fileName, final Reader reader, final String... params )
237            {
238                final List<String> lines;
239                try( final var bufferedReader = new BufferedReader( reader ) )
240                {
241                    lines = bufferedReader.lines()
242                        .map( StringUtils::escapeHTML )
243                        .collect( toList() );
244                }
245                catch( final IOException e )
246                {
247                    throw new JavadocError( format( MSG_ProcessingProblem, fileName ), e );
248                }
249
250                final var lineNumberFormat = createLineNumberFormatString( lines.size() );
251
252                var lineNumber = 1;
253                final var buffer = new StringBuilder( "<div class=\"source-container\"><pre>" );
254                for( final var line : lines )
255                {
256                    buffer.append( format( lineNumberFormat, lineNumber++ ) )
257                        .append( line )
258                        .append( '\n' );
259                }
260
261                final var retValue = buffer.append( "</pre></div>" ).toString();
262
263                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
264                return retValue;
265            }   //  processFile()
266        },
267
268        /**
269         *  <p>{@summary The file contents is source code of some kind.} It will
270         *  be treated as for
271         *  {@link #SOURCE},
272         *  but only the lines between a line starting with
273         *  {@value #SOURCE_SNIP_START}
274         *  and another one beginning with
275         *  {@value #SOURCE_SNIP_END}
276         *  or the end of the file.</p>
277         *  <p>The line numbers are as for the full file.</p>
278         *  <p>Additionally, a snippet can be selected by its index if there
279         *  are more than one snippet marked in the source file.</p>
280         */
281        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
282        SOURCE_SNIPPET
283        {
284            /**
285             *  Returns all snippets.
286             *
287             *  @param  buffer  The output buffer.
288             *  @param  lines   The lines of the file.
289             *  @param  lineNumberFormat    The line number format String.
290             */
291            private final void allSnippets( final StringBuilder buffer, final Iterable<String> lines, final String lineNumberFormat )
292            {
293                var lineNumber = 1;
294                var includeLine = false;
295                AppendLoop:for( final var line : lines )
296                {
297                    if( line.startsWith( SOURCE_SNIP_START ) )
298                    {
299                        includeLine = true;
300                        if( lineNumber > 1 ) buffer.append( "&hellip;\n" );
301                        continue AppendLoop;
302                    }
303                    if( line.startsWith( SOURCE_SNIP_END ) )
304                    {
305                        includeLine = false;
306                        buffer.append( "&hellip;\n" );
307                        continue AppendLoop;
308                    }
309                    if( includeLine )
310                    {
311                        buffer.append( format( lineNumberFormat, lineNumber ) )
312                            .append( line )
313                            .append( '\n' );
314                    }
315                    ++lineNumber;
316                }   //  AppendLoop:
317            }   //  allSnippets()
318
319            /**
320             *  Returns one single snippet, identified by the index.
321             *
322             *  @param  buffer  The output buffer.
323             *  @param  lines   The lines of the file.
324             *  @param  lineNumberFormat    The line number format String.
325             *  @param  index   The number of the snippet, with 1 for the first
326             *      snippet.
327             */
328            private final void oneSnippet( final StringBuilder buffer, final Iterable<String> lines, final String lineNumberFormat, final int index )
329            {
330                var lineNumber = 1;
331                final List<StringBuilder> snippets = new ArrayList<>();
332                StringBuilder localBuffer = null;
333                AppendLoop:for( final var line : lines )
334                {
335                    if( line.startsWith( SOURCE_SNIP_START ) )
336                    {
337                        localBuffer = new StringBuilder();
338                        snippets.add( localBuffer );
339                        if( lineNumber > 1 ) localBuffer.append( "&hellip;\n" );
340                        continue AppendLoop;
341                    }
342                    if( line.startsWith( SOURCE_SNIP_END ) )
343                    {
344                        if( nonNull( localBuffer ) )
345                        {
346                            localBuffer.append( "&hellip;\n" );
347                            //noinspection AssignmentToNull
348                            localBuffer = null;
349                        }
350                        continue AppendLoop;
351                    }
352                    if( nonNull( localBuffer ) )
353                    {
354                        localBuffer.append( format( lineNumberFormat, lineNumber ) )
355                            .append( line )
356                            .append( '\n' );
357                    }
358                    ++lineNumber;
359                }   //  AppendLoop:
360
361                if( index - 1 <= snippets.size() )
362                {
363                    buffer.append( snippets.get( index - 1 ) );
364                }
365                else
366                {
367                    out.printf( "Cannot include snippet %d, only %d defined\n", index, snippets.size() );
368                }
369            }   //  oneSnippet()
370
371            /**
372             *  {@inheritDoc}
373             */
374            @Override
375            public final String processFile( final String fileName, final Reader reader, final String... params )
376            {
377                final List<String> lines;
378                try( final var bufferedReader = new BufferedReader( reader ) )
379                {
380                    lines = bufferedReader.lines()
381                        .map( StringUtils::escapeHTML )
382                        .collect( toList() );
383                }
384                catch( final IOException e )
385                {
386                    throw new JavadocError( format( MSG_ProcessingProblem, fileName ), e );
387                }
388
389                final var lineNumberFormat = createLineNumberFormatString( lines.size() );
390
391                final var buffer = new StringBuilder( "<div class=\"source-container\"><pre>" );
392                if( params.length == 0 )
393                {
394                    allSnippets( buffer, lines, lineNumberFormat );
395                }
396                else
397                {
398                    try
399                    {
400                        final var index = Integer.parseInt( params [0] );
401                        oneSnippet( buffer, lines, lineNumberFormat, index );
402                    }
403                    catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final NumberFormatException e )
404                    {
405                        out.printf( "Invalid value for snippet index: %s\n", params [0] );
406                        allSnippets( buffer, lines, lineNumberFormat );
407                    }
408                }
409
410                final var retValue = buffer.append( "</pre></div>" ).toString();
411
412                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
413                return retValue;
414            }   //  processFile()
415        };
416
417            /*---------*\
418        ====** Methods **======================================================
419            \*---------*/
420        /**
421         *  Processes the given file.
422         *
423         *  @param  fileName    The name of the file to process; used for error
424         *      messages only.
425         *  @param  reader    The file to process.
426         *  @param  params  Optional parameters for the processing.
427         *  @return  The processed file contents.
428         *
429         *  @since 0.1.0
430         */
431        @API( status = INTERNAL, since ="0.1.0" )
432        public abstract String processFile( final String fileName, final Reader reader, String ... params );
433
434        /**
435         *  Processes the given file.
436         *
437         *  @param  file    The file to process.
438         *  @param  params  Optional parameters for the processing.
439         *  @return  The processed file contents.
440         */
441        public final String processFile( final FileObject file, final String ... params )
442        {
443            final String retValue;
444            try( final var reader = file.openReader( true ) )
445            {
446                retValue = processFile( file.getName(), reader, params );
447            }
448            catch( final IOException e )
449            {
450                throw new JavadocError( format( "Cannot open Reader on file '%s'", file.getName() ), e );
451            }
452
453            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
454            return retValue;
455        }   //  processFile()
456    }
457    //  enum ProcessMode
458
459        /*-----------*\
460    ====** Constants **========================================================
461        \*-----------*/
462    /**
463     *  The error message indicating a problem when processing the include
464     *  file.
465     */
466    public static final String MSG_ProcessingProblem = "Problems on processing '%s'";
467
468    /**
469     *  The prefix for the name of a property that holds the root for path of
470     *  an include file: {@value}. It will be set on the {@code javadoc}
471     *  command line like this:
472     *  <pre><code>-J-Dorg.tquadrat.foundation.include.root.&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;=&lt;<i>path</i>&gt;</code></pre>
473     *  {@ignore -J-Dorg.tquadrat.foundation.include.root.<name>=<path>}
474     */
475    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
476    public static final String PROPERTY_INCLUDE_ROOT_PREFIX = "org.tquadrat.foundation.include.root";
477
478    /**
479     *  The snippet end marker for source code: {@value}.
480     */
481    public static final String SOURCE_SNIP_END = "/\u002ASNIP_END\u002A/";
482
483    /**
484     *  The snippet start marker for source code: {@value}.
485     */
486    public static final String SOURCE_SNIP_START = "/\u002ASNIP_START\u002A/";
487
488    /**
489     *  The name of this taglet: {@value}.
490     */
491    public static final String TAGLET_NAME = "include";
492
493        /*------------*\
494    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
495        \*------------*/
496    /**
497     *  The doclet.
498     */
499    @SuppressWarnings( {"FieldCanBeLocal", "unused"} )
500    private Doclet m_Doclet;
501
502    /**
503     *  The doclet environment.
504     */
505    private DocletEnvironment m_DocletEnvironment;
506
507        /*--------------*\
508    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
509        \*--------------*/
510    /**
511     *  Creates a new {@code IncludeTaglet} instance.
512     */
513    @SuppressWarnings( "RedundantNoArgConstructor" )
514    public IncludeTaglet() { /* Just exists */ }
515
516        /*---------*\
517    ====** Methods **==========================================================
518        \*---------*/
519    /**
520     *  {@inheritDoc}
521     */
522    @Override
523    public final Set<Location> getAllowedLocations() { return EnumSet.allOf( Location.class ); }
524
525    /**
526     *  {@inheritDoc}
527     */
528    @Override
529    public final String getName() { return TAGLET_NAME; }
530
531    /**
532     *  {@inheritDoc}
533     */
534    @Override
535    public final void init( final DocletEnvironment docletEnvironment, final Doclet doclet )
536    {
537        Taglet.super.init( docletEnvironment, doclet );
538        m_Doclet = doclet;
539        m_DocletEnvironment = docletEnvironment;
540        initHelperTaglets( docletEnvironment, doclet );
541    }   //  init()
542
543    /**
544     *  {@inheritDoc}
545     */
546    @Override
547    public  final boolean isInlineTag() { return true; }
548
549    /**
550     *  Looks up the system properties for a root path for include files with
551     *  the given name (the full name would be the prefix
552     *  {@value #PROPERTY_INCLUDE_ROOT_PREFIX}
553     *  appended by the argument, separated by a '.'.
554     *
555     *  @param  variable    The name of the root path.
556     *  @return A instance of
557     *      {@link Optional}
558     *      that holds the path.
559     */
560    private static final Optional<String> rootPathRetriever( final String variable )
561    {
562        Optional<String> retValue = Optional.empty();
563        if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( variable ) )
564        {
565            final var key = format( "%s.%s", PROPERTY_INCLUDE_ROOT_PREFIX, variable );
566            final var fileName = getProperty( key );
567            if( nonNull( fileName ) ) retValue = Optional.of( new File( fileName ).getAbsolutePath() );
568        }
569
570        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
571        return retValue;
572    }   //  rootPathRetriever()
573
574    /**
575     *  {@inheritDoc}
576     */
577    @Override
578    public final String toString( final List<? extends DocTree> tags, final Element element )
579    {
580        var retValue = EMPTY_STRING;
581
582        final var tag = tags.get( 0 ).toString().trim();
583        final var len = tag.length() - 1;
584        final var prefixLen = getName().length() + 3;
585        final var contents = tag.substring( prefixLen, len ).trim();
586
587        final var parts = splitString( contents, ':' );
588        final String fileName;
589        final ProcessMode processMode;
590        final String [] parameters;
591
592        switch( parts.length )
593        {
594            case 0 ->
595            {
596                //---* No argument for the tag *-------------------------------
597                fileName = EMPTY_STRING;
598                //noinspection AssignmentToNull
599                processMode = null;
600                //noinspection AssignmentToNull
601                parameters = null;
602            }
603            case 1 ->
604            {
605                //---* Just the file name *------------------------------------
606                fileName = new Template( parts[0].trim() ).replaceVariable( IncludeTaglet::rootPathRetriever );
607                processMode = DEFAULT;
608                parameters = EMPTY_String_ARRAY;
609            }
610            case 2 ->
611            {
612                //---* A file name and the process mode *----------------------
613                fileName = new Template( parts[0].trim() ).replaceVariable( IncludeTaglet::rootPathRetriever );
614                ProcessMode p;
615                try
616                {
617                    p = ProcessMode.valueOf( parts[1].trim() );
618                }
619                catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final IllegalArgumentException e )
620                {
621                    p = DEFAULT;
622                }
623                processMode = p;
624                parameters = EMPTY_String_ARRAY;
625            }
626            default ->
627            {
628                //---* A file name and the process mode plus some parameters *-
629                fileName = new Template( parts[0].trim() ).replaceVariable( IncludeTaglet::rootPathRetriever );
630                ProcessMode p;
631                try
632                {
633                    p = ProcessMode.valueOf( parts[1].trim() );
634                }
635                catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final IllegalArgumentException e )
636                {
637                    p = DEFAULT;
638                }
639                processMode = p;
640                final var length = parts.length - 2;
641                parameters = new String[length];
642                arraycopy( parts, 2, parameters, 0, length );
643            }
644        }
645
646        if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( fileName ) )
647        {
648            if( fileName.startsWith( "/" ) )
649            {
650                //---* An absolute path based on an external root *------------
651                final var file = new File( fileName );
652                if( !file.exists() )
653                {
654                    final var elementName = determineElementName( element );
655                    out.printf( "Cannot locate the include file '%2$s' for '%1$s'%n", elementName, fileName );
656                }
657                //noinspection OverlyBroadCatchBlock
658                try( final Reader reader = new FileReader( file ) )
659                {
660                    retValue = processMode.processFile( fileName, reader, parameters );
661                }
662                catch( final IOException e )
663                {
664                    //---* Should never happen *-------------------------------
665                    final var elementName = determineElementName( element );
666                    out.printf( "Failed to include the file '%2$s' for '%1$s'%n", elementName, fileName );
667                }
668            }
669            else if( !fileName.startsWith( "$" ) )
670            {
671                //---* A relative path *---------------------------------------
672                try
673                {
674                    @SuppressWarnings( "resource" )
675                    final var inputFile = m_DocletEnvironment.getJavaFileManager().getFileForInput( SOURCE_PATH, EMPTY_STRING, fileName );
676                    if( nonNull( inputFile) )
677                    {
678                        retValue = processMode.processFile( inputFile, parameters );
679                    }
680                    else
681                    {
682                        final var elementName = determineElementName( element );
683                        out.printf( "Failed to include the file '%2$s' for '%1$s'%n", elementName, fileName );
684                    }
685                }
686                catch( final IOException e )
687                {
688                    throw new JavadocError( format( "Problems getting FileObject for '%s'", fileName ), e );
689                }
690            }
691            else
692            {
693                //---* Retrieval for the root path failed *--------------------
694                final var elementName = determineElementName( element );
695                out.printf( "Failed to resolve include file '%2$s' for '%1$s'%n", elementName, fileName );
696            }
697        }
698
699        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
700        return retValue;
701    }   //  toString()
702}
703//  class IncludeTaglet
704
705/*
706 *  End of File
707 */
